channel.title: A little audio help ?
channel.description:
Alright I need some audio expertise its not somthing I really know about. I recently blew my P.C speakers, and I have a unsed T.V surround system 5.1 and I was wondering if it is possible to use that with my computer.
Im not sure it is but if anyone could let me know for sure I would mightly appreciate it.

item.title: A little audio help ?
item.dc:creator: Gom_Jabbar
item.description:
Collision I’ve already answerd that question in post 13* of this thread. Enjoy the tale of woe and stupidity.

Tried the cable today, 2.1ch sound works on all 4 working speakers. Tried the diffrent parts of the 5.1 they all seem to work. Apart from the central speaker Im thinking its proberly been broken in storage, tried a diffrent line/conection and no joy.

Still 4.1 sound is still better than my stand-in speakers, and there even better than the speakers they were replacing. I’ll get the last two cables now that I Know the’ll work 2mrw.

And i’ll leave one more post tomorrow with the results.

Edit

I have bought the aditional cables and now its all working perfectly, I am very happy with the set up at least this way I can give black mesa the sound it deserves when it comes out.

It like to say thank you to everyone who gave me advice. I do apreciate it allot.

Read full topic

item.title: A little audio help ?
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
its the same 5.1
I looked at the pic of your soundsystem inputs and I can tell you those inputs are the same as for computer 5.1 systems.

sorry for bad quality

Read full topic

item.title: A little audio help ?
item.dc:creator: Gom_Jabbar
item.description:
Well To be honest blows proberly the wrong term (I just wanted to sound cool ) they finally died after I put them through some seriouse abuse, Played allot louder than I really should of. stretched them a Bit too often, they stopped after a heavy session of drum and bass, heavy metal and a small drop to the floor.
I also think this song didnt help https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mq5GdutCRo8 dub step not speaker freindly.

But I got my moneys worth they lasted a good three years of Gaming and student partys. So no regrets.

Well apart from the fact im now using 10yr old pc speakers with no sub, I think you can guess how bad they sound.

and pfannkuchen_ges yes that thought did occur to me a while after you sugested the spliter, but even if I did that im not sure it would work as I read that Computers apart from when playing films use a diffrent kind of 5.1 sound that Tvs use (not dolby/dts). Sounds a bit odd to me that they would be that difrent but, I think i’ll try with the one cable splitter and test the pairs of speakers individualy before I invest in more of them cause there not that cheap. but cheers for the idea.

Read full topic

item.title: A little audio help ?
item.dc:creator: Gom_Jabbar
item.description:
Good idea to check, but there just the standard clips for speaker wire. Daft question do you reckon it would be possible to wire standered stero wire into a 3.1 jack and connect the diffrent speakers directly up to a sound card? it is a 5.1 sound card.

edit yer pretty sure you cant,

Read full topic

item.title: A little audio help ?
item.dc:creator: Gom_Jabbar
item.description:
opps wrong forum you live an you learn.

There were a pretty cheap set that were made buy Acoustic Solutions model number- AS 135.

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?pid=8869046&l=51954c2627&id=760320252

Picture of the back all the leads are co-axcel so I have no idea how you could get that working with a pc, Thanks for the help so far.

Read full topic

item.title: A little audio help ?
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Yes, find the audio in ports, most likely a red and blue circle, and you can get a cable that leads from your computer to there.

I don’t know about getting it surround sound, but it’s a start.

Read full topic
